Body: Description: Good afternoon, The PrivatBank customer investigating and started debug logging. When downloading the log file, we encountered the problem that the eppclient.log file was empty. We have try to recreate but were enabled. Please find attached a screenshot of the zip file with logs.

@Daniel Anton​ The screenshot from the C drive shows the presence of the eppclient_append.log file. That is the same as the eppclient.log, except it does not empty out when the service is restarted. Those files were manually created by the support tool. I recommend disabling debug mode and removing any epp log files from the C drive. After a reboot, enable the debug mode again and see if the eppclient.log file populates.

 

note: if the logs are needed, they can use the eppclient_append.log file. So they should be able to copy it to another location before performing the steps sent.

What We've Learned Updated: 06-05 The PrivatBank customer investigating and started debug logging. When downloading the log file, we encountered the problem that the file was empty.

07-05 We have requested more details regarding this case and a screenshot. 

08-05 We start the investigation of the scenario.

14-05 We involved our T2 support .

15-05 We have analyse the case internally and we found that in the screenshot from the C drive shows the presence of the eppclient_append.log file.
That is the same as the eppclient.log, except it does not empty out when the service is restarted.
Those files were manually created by the support tool.
I recommend disabling debug mode and removing any epp.log files from the C drive.
After a reboot, enable the debug mode again and see if the eppclient.log file populates.

Next Steps Updated: 07-05 Waiting for customer to provide details.

15-05 Waiting for customer to test the steps.
